column1: Uchi////I have eaten at Uchi twice
column2: and I think the food is unsurpassed by other Japanese restaurants in Houston.  (But if you're ever in D.C.
column3: please try Makoto.)  The food is innovative without sacrificing good flavors.   The first time I went I had the six-course tasting menu.  Last Saturday I had a mix of things
column4: including the my favs the Brussels Sprouts
column5: Walu Walu (try this!) and lime ash dessert.  The staff is unpretentious and friendly
column6: and have made my visits relaxing and enjoyable.  The ambience is . . . I just hope it doesn't turn into one of those see-and-be-seen places where the food begins to take a backseat to the ambience.  So far so good
column7: though.  I hope to be back.
